TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: Rapar: pai pai, sa rukamayamayanga sun.
Rapar: pai pai, sa rokamayamayanga son.
S.TRANSL: Rapar: Well, you’re always the same.

S.FORM: aitsu ki sun a natemekel tu sa vava pai.
aico ki son a natemekel to sa vava pai.
S.TRANSL: Now presumably you’ve been drinking beer.
Tsudjuy: What are you saying?

S.FORM: mapulaw aya sun a benuru a paqeteleng(?).
mapolaw aya son a benoro a paqeteleng(?).
S.TRANSL: Are you having the cheek to lie and say I’m drunk?
Rapar: Yes, what about it?

S.FORM: tsunu tsunu sa su sikudan a matu makapalapalak, matu ika tsautsau.
cono cono sa so sikodan a mato makapalapalak, mato ika caocao.
S.TRANSL: Look at your behaviour, acting like a madman, not like a human being.
(He hits her.) Ow ow!
I’m dying.

S.FORM: aku ken uri su papatsayin qa?
ako ken ori so papacayin qa?
S.TRANSL: Why are you going to kill me?
What’s the matter with you?
My life has been shortened.

S.FORM: kina ni Rapar: qai, sa ku ałak.
kina ni Rapar: qai, sa ko aljak.
S.TRANSL: Rapar’s mother: Oh, my child!
What are you up to, children?
She’ll die.
Kemay (neighbour): Well,
yes.
Why is this such a surprise?

S.FORM: aku a paulan nu sa tsautsau?
ako a paolan no sa caocao?
S.TRANSL: What a waste of a person!

S.FORM: aku manu manganga maya ti su qali?
ako mano manganga maya ti so qali?
S.TRANSL: Why is your friend such a scoundrel?
Rapar’s mother: All right all right; that’s fine.
You’ve had enough.

S.FORM: aku manu su kiayayan sakamaya tjai su qali a manganga su kełangen?
ako mano so kiayayan sakamaya tjai so qali a manganga so keljangen?
S.TRANSL: Then why are you always going with your friend who is a scoundrel, as you well know?

S.FORM: Tsudjuy: saka ari aya ti qali.
Codjoy: saka ari aya ti qali.
S.TRANSL: Tsudjuy: Well my friend says Come on;
and I would be bullied (if I didn’t).

S.FORM: kina: qau manu ari nu aya, kiayan sun; łakua tjenglay sun uta kaumaya tua kidjadjalan tjai su qali.
kina: qao mano ari no aya, kiayan son; ljakoa tjenglay son ota kaomaya toa kidjadjalan tjai so qali.
S.TRANSL: Rapar’s mother: Oh, so you go with him when he says Come on; but perhaps you also like going with your friend.

S.FORM: Tsudjuy: ika ken a uri kiayan anga nu tjaivilił.
Codjoy: ika ken a ori kiayan anga no tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: Tsudjuy: I’m not going to go with him any more.
